Sore Loser, not so bad..
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2002 Topics ( Year Of The Password): Sore Loser, not so bad..
By Harle on Saturday, March 2, 2002 - 10:48 pm:

I would have posted this elsewhere, but the characteristics board wasn't open anymore..so you know..
I dunno why, but I really like Nagas. I guess they have a bad rap for their looks and short lifespan. Oh, and their bad attitude..and the fact that they like barely anything ^^;;..Well all those aside...
I just like training them. So I'm gonna try and get as much info on them as possible, and try to train a pretty decent one. ((My schedule permitting!Plus I do train other monsters))
Anyway, I noticed the characteristic "Sore Loser", and at first assumed it was a bad thing to have. But after watching a few battles I noticed something..
When Tidus(Merman) faced a monster and was struck first, he tends to get more critical attacks afterwords. I'm not sure if this is just coincidence though.
Example: Against a Mew with high speed: After missing the first few shots, Tidus is hit by Scratch for around 34 damage.
He turns around with a Heavy Punch, and knocks off around 144 damage. (critical)
Dunno if this is just weird though, I'm sure someone can read further into it since I've just started playing..just dropping an observation though!

By PezCat on Thursday, March 7, 2002 - 05:22 pm:

Well, Harle, as far as I can tell, it's not really
-that- bad a trait, as you say. Of course, I'm
still on my first monster in MR3, since I just got
the game after months of looking, but my
Scurfy seems to not have been affected that I
can see. Of course, don't take my word for it...
I got bounced back down from master to
rookie when I moved from MR2 to MR3. That
and I kind of like the "Sore Loser" trait... it fit
very well with the mentality that the Hare
seems to have.

PezCat
